channel.title: Please help pi source 317

item.title: Please help pi source 317
item.dc:creator: @sonsofgod2 sonsofgod2
item.description:
@sonsofgod2 wrote:

well i when i changed it to 7334 the items kept on death in the quest tab is at the top saying items kept on death but i click on it nothing happens. but if i click were the 7341 is like pirate treasures it comes up showing what i keep. how do i make it so it shows on 7334.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help pi source 317
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Buttons are added according to interface, so the ID would be the same for the button.

Though, the text would show up depending on different occasions, such as skulled, prayer, etc.
The button will also do separate functions depending on variables, etc.

The 7341 is only a text String to place the text on a certain line on that interface.

Read full topic

item.title: Please help pi source 317
item.dc:creator: @sonsofgod2 sonsofgod2
item.description:
@sonsofgod2 wrote:

Pi source
317

[ftp=ftp://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/268892-pi-items-kept-death-server-sided-quest-tab.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/268892-pi-items-kept-death-server-sided-quest-tab.html[/ftp]

Heres the turtoriel i used.

This is so items kept with death, i just addded in quest. and here are the codes…

for the client.java

getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@Items Kept on Death", 7341); i changed the 7341 to 7334.

and heres the clickbutton.java

case 28173:
if(!c.isSkulled) {
c.getItems().resetKeepItems();
c.getItems().keepItem(0, false);
c.getItems().keepItem(1, false);
c.getItems().keepItem(2, false);
c.getItems().keepItem(3, false);
c.sendMessage(“You can keep three items and a fourth if you use the protect item prayer.”);
} else {
c.getItems().resetKeepItems();
c.getItems().keepItem(0, false);
c.sendMessage(“You are skulled and will only keep one item if you use the protect item prayer.”);
}
c.getItems().sendItemsKept();
c.getPA().showInterface(6960);
c.getItems().resetKeepItems();
break;

If you editted the client.java number to bring it up, find that case number and modify it fittingly.)

So whats the case number for the 7334 ? please help

Read full topic
